intro: Tapiscia, commonly known as the coral tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its showy, colorful inflorescences that resemble coral, hence its common name. Tapiscia species typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, clustered flowers. Some species are cultivated for their ornamental value and are used in traditional medicine.
